Spectra plotting with ggplot2

Source: R/qplot.R
qplotc.Rd

Spectra plotting with ggplot2

qplotc(
  object,
  mapping = aes_string(x = "c", y = "spc"),
  ...,
  func = NULL,
  func.args = list(),
  map.pointonly = FALSE
)

Arguments

object

hyperSpec object
mapping

see ggplot2::geom_point()
...

handed to ggplot2::geom_point()
func

function to summarize the wavelengths, if NULL, only the first wavelength is used
func.args

arguments to func
map.pointonly

if TRUE, mapping will be handed to ggplot2::geom_point() instead of ggplot2::ggplot().

Value

a ggplot2::ggplot() object

Details

These functions are still experimental and may change in future.

See also

plotc()

ggplot2::ggplot(), ggplot2::geom_point()

Author

Claudia Beleites

Examples

qplotc(flu)
#> Warning: Intensity at first wavelengh only is used.
qplotc(flu) + geom_smooth(method = "lm")
#> Warning: Intensity at first wavelengh only is used.
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'
